title: Mo Brooks
added: In March 2018, he was rated the House's most [[partisan politics|partisan politician]] by [[The Lugar Center]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelugarcenter.org/ourwork-Bipartisan-Index.html|title=The Lugar Center - McCourt School Bipartisan Index; House Scores 115th Congress, 1st session (2017)|date=May 24, 2018|access-date=June 3, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180603222533/http://www.thelugarcenter.org/ourwork-Bipartisan-Index.html|archive-date=June 3, 2018|url-status=live|df=mdy-all}}</ref>

title: Mo Brooks
added: In March 2018, he was rated the House's most [[partisan politics|partisan politician]] by [[The Lugar Center]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.thelugarcenter.org/ourwork-Bipartisan-Index.html|title=The Lugar Center - McCourt School Bipartisan Index; House Scores 115th Congress, 1st session (2017)|date=May 24, 2018|access-date=June 3, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180603222533/http://www.thelugarcenter.org/ourwork-Bipartisan-Index.html|archive-date=June 3, 2018|url-status=live|df=mdy-all}}</ref><ref>[https://www.thelugarcenter.org/assets/htmldocuments/House%20Scores%20115th%20Congress%20First%20Session.pdf 115th Congress Partisanship Index - PDF], accessed January 4, 2021</ref>

title: Mo Brooks
deleted: On January 6, 2021, Congressman Brooks helped incite violence in the U.S. Capitol.<ref>{{Cite web|date=2021-01-06|title=Mo Brooks: Today patriots start ‘kicking ass’ in fighting vote results|url=https://www.al.com/news/2021/01/mo-brooks-today-patriots-start-kicking-ass-in-fighting-vote-results.html|access-date=2021-01-07|website=al|language=en}}</ref>

title: Mo Brooks
deleted: When New York Congress incumbent [[Eliot Engel]] lost the [[2020 United States House of Representatives elections|2020 United States House of Representatives election]] to [[Jamaal Bowman]], Brooks stated that voters who voted against Engel were racists, anti-Semites, socialists, and sexists.<ref>{{cite web |title=House Foreign Affairs Comm. Chair #EliotEngel trailing 60% to 35% in Dem Primary, with only mail in ballots uncounted.  Why losing?  Engel is:  White Male Jewish Moderate  #RACISM, #SEXISM, ANTI-#ISRAEL, #SOCIALISM DOMINATE #DEMOCRAT PARTY!  Ask Reps Joe Crowley & Dan Lipinski! |url=https://twitter.com/RepMoBrooks/status/1275731239182401536 |website=Twitter |access-date=20 July 2020 |language=en |date=24 June 2020}}</ref>{{better source|date=January 2021}}

title: Mo Brooks
deleted: Brooks opposes the [[Equal Rights Amendment]], believing that it discriminates against men and religious freedom.<ref>{{cite web |title=BADLY written #EqualRightsAmendment THREATENS:  #Catholics & others’ religious freedom for "men only" priests!  #NFL, #NBA and ALL mens sports without 50% female players!  ALL female college & pro sports by REQUIRING men competitors!  & MORE!  Today I vote AGAINST bad #ERA bill! |url=https://twitter.com/RepMoBrooks/status/1227983512881549312 |website=Twitter |access-date=20 July 2020 |language=en |date=13 February 2020}}</ref>

title: Mo Brooks
added: Brooks was the first member of Congress to announce his objection to the [[2021 United States Electoral College vote count|certification]] of the Electoral College results on January 6, 2021.<ref name=":6">{{Cite web|date=2021-01-06|title=Mo Brooks: Today patriots start 'kicking ass' in fighting vote results|url=https://www.al.com/news/2021/01/mo-brooks-today-patriots-start-kicking-ass-in-fighting-vote-results.html|access-date=2021-01-07|website=al|language=en}}</ref><ref name=":8">{{Cite web|title=Here Are The Republicans Challenging Congress' Tally Of Election Results|url=https://www.npr.org/sections/congress-electoral-college-tally-live-updates/2021/01/06/953714213/here-are-the-republicans-challenging-congress-tally-of-election-results|access-date=2021-01-07|website=NPR.org|language=en}}</ref> That day, he spoke at a pro-Trump rally and harshly criticized other Republicans in Congress for not aiding him in his efforts to overturn the election.<ref name=":7">{{Cite web|last=Lyman|first=Melissa Brown, Kirsten Fiscus and Brian|title='A very dark day': Alabama's congressional delegation condemns riot at U.S. Capitol|url=https://www.montgomeryadvertiser.com/story/news/2021/01/06/trump-supporters-storm-us-capitol-dc-riot-alabama-congressman-react/4138779001/|access-date=2021-01-07|website=The Montgomery Advertiser|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":6" />

Brooks said, "Today is the day American patriots start taking down names and kicking ass."<ref name=":6" /> At the rally, Trump falsely claimed that the election had been stolen and encouraged the crowd to march on the U.S. Capitol; shortly thereafter, pro-Trump rioters [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|stormed the U.S. Capitol]], resulting in five deaths, including a [[United States Capitol Police|police officer]]'s.<ref name=":7" /><ref>{{cite web |title=Capitol Police officer dies from injuries suffered in riots, federal murder investigation opened |url=https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/capitol-police-officer-dies-injuries-suffered-riots/story?id=75124131 |website=ABC News |access-date=January 9, 2021 |date=January 8, 2021}}</ref> Brooks later said the rioters who stormed the Capitol were associated with [[antifa (United States)|Antifa]], citing information in ''[[The Washington Times]]'' that was later retracted.<ref name=":7" /><ref>{{Cite web|last=http://www.washingtontimes.com|first=The Washington Times|title=CORRECTED: Facial recognition identifies extremists storming the Capitol|url=https://www.washingtontimes.com/news/2021/jan/6/xrvision-firm-claims-antifa-infiltrated-protesters/|access-date=2021-03-08|website=The Washington Times|language=en-US}}</ref> Brooks still went on to object to [[Nevada]]'s electoral votes, but no senator joined him.

In December 2020, right-wing political activist and organizer [[Ali Alexander]] said that Brooks and Representatives [[Andy Biggs]] and [[Paul Gosar]] were involved in organizing a mob to pressure Congress. These alleged plans resulted in the [[2021 storming of the United States Capitol|storming of the United States Capitol]]; according to Alexander, who defended the Capitol events as "completely peaceful", "It was to build momentum and pressure and then on the day change hearts and minds of Congress peoples who weren't yet decided or who saw everyone outside and said, 'I can't be on the other side of that mob.'" Brooks's office has not responded to media inquiries about this allegation.<ref>{{Cite web|last=CNN|first=Rob Kuznia, Curt Devine, Scott Bronstein and Bob Ortega|title=Extremists intensify calls for violence ahead of Inauguration Day|url=https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/08/us/online-extremism-inauguration-capitol-invs/index.html|access-date=2021-03-08|website=CNN}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|last=Sommer|first=Will|date=2021-01-11|title='Stop the Steal' Organizer in Hiding After Denying Blame for Riot|language=en|work=The Daily Beast|url=https://www.thedailybeast.com/stop-the-steal-organizer-in-hiding-after-denying-blame-for-riot|access-date=2021-03-08}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Hansen|first=Robert Anglen and Ronald J.|title=Reps. Paul Gosar, Andy Biggs credited in video with organizing Trump crowd in DC on day of riot|url=https://www.azcentral.com/story/news/politics/arizona/2021/01/10/paul-gosar-andy-biggs-credited-video-organizing-trump-crowd-dc/6603721002/|access-date=2021-03-08|website=The Arizona Republic|language=en-US}}</ref>
